documents.document: @danwaters @migueldeicaza Xamarin Evolve: Down Under would be a most excellent thing. Planning should start immediately. :)

@terrajobst @paulcbetts @onovotny @ziki_cz @ben_a_adams @blowdart I support this proposal.
@paulcbetts cool story bro. Can you point me in the direction to some whitepapers? K thx.
@Cheesebaron @stuebe2k14 ugh people do, seriously. It's the Bathurst 1000. https://t.co/nZy5ymDxdn
@Cheesebaron @stuebe2k14 not completely banned just restricted to 24 cans per day per person. https://t.co/b09li1MPWT
@Cheesebaron @stuebe2k14 bringing in alcohol is banned. So what do Aussies do? Couple weeks before. Burry it. Dig it out. Drink.
@Cheesebaron oh the irony. I have to VPN to outside of Australia to watch something happening in Australia. https://t.co/mp0dXUsu8P
@kathikcouk @997unix deploy somewhere, automatically. Doesn't have to be production direct to users (though that's where the most value is)
@rid00z @NBN_Australia check out their Instagram account. They have lost the plot.
Cake.AppleSimulator v0.1.0 has been released; https://t.co/6wOmrtJuw3 - see https://t.co/Z2tIJvrktP for backstory. #xamarin
@redth that would be would be super awesome - start with OSX first then xplat (no hyperv) - METHODS: start, install, launch, stop
@redth @github oh I see https://t.co/vR6kJ2bRZl Keep it as is. Nobody got time for that junk. Dev's already accepted the lic as part of dev.
@redth Cake.AppleSimulator is production ready - see https://t.co/UhiBmNHW1O for some bleeding edge innovation with it.
@redth looks like license acceptance is WIP - was thinking to do this outside of cake via https://t.co/0RgyhGv0HV as a bootstrap.sh
@redth integration testing/running platform unit tests as part of cake is now closer reality. AppVeyor for build, Bitrise for CI (simulator)
@redth iOS is solved + working, android (free) needs solving. This landed the other day https://t.co/ybAABA6kHQ which means CI (as in /1...

@redth cake.genymotion works well for simulators but the licensing activation situation is _really_ incompatible with CI/box that get wiped.

@ladyleet @BenLesh where's the hat?
@Chris_Sewell side by side install with VS15 and Xamarin highly not advisable. Only safe if you remain alpha channel but VS15 will be broke.
@terrajobst hey duders; are you aware of any tooling to automatically create a dotnet diff of public API contracts? Would be a nifty PR bot.
@KrauseFx @playgroundscon @tryswiftconf I would like to watch the shit out of this talk. If you need a reviewer DM. Going through this ATM.
Dear @zapier. I am in love. Like most couples, I share a calendar. This zap communicates what I'm doing and my comm… https://t.co/RoCUuG2soi
@JackUkleja yuuuppp; direct to consumer is dead, B2B/B2E/B2C still alive. Progressive web-apps might be the future for direct to consumer.
@daveaglick @dotnetfringe are you going to train it from Seattle?
@ladyleet little bit jelly right now.
@daveaglick when is @dotnetfringe ? Whats the dates. It's on my to-do for this year for sure.
@coolcsh had a serious look into supporting Tizen. Blocked by https://t.co/797GSdG7r5 - can't target platform with nuget.
@redth @kent_boogaart you should speak with @James_M_South and use his library @redth.
@ThomasBurkhartB @mhvdijk I'll trade my knowledge for that PR to the docs :p
@GeoffreyHuntley @mhvdijk so from a framework perspective, no need to install the SDK on CI host and/or contributors PCs. Not a burden. #yes
@mhvdijk @TizenProject No reference assemblies installed into usual place; instead https://t.co/njX8oR75sM & https://t.co/PcZLNbtkRQ
@mhvdijk @TizenProject @MvvmCross :boom: https://t.co/797GSdG7r5 :boom: - blocked, hardcore.
@martinwoodward re: tizen - looks like it's not possible to target the platform as a library author at the moment. https://t.co/797GSdG7r5
@ethomson @VSTeam insanely cool. Nice.
@BerayBentesen DM? Interested in hearing your thoughts. Just installed the SDK and have had thoughts about adding it as a platform.
Any #xamarin developers tried out @TizenProject yet?
@jaredpar highly recommend checking out how phrabicator does project mgmt with git. It rocks.
@jaredpar generating release notes automatically. That's all they are good for. One label per platform.
@ajpinedam twitter DM me your email address and it's yours. I'll send a slack invite.
@Philco78 @slace piracy. Though less of a thing now because of torrents, RAR === extracting scene releases.
Yo @yourfirstpr. We have an opportunity for someone in the @dotnet community who hasn't sent in a PR before. https://t.co/RGrto9Rd0S
@davkean where's the title field? (Not trolling; it's just missing)
@marcgravell reinstalled laptop the other night cause vs 17 broke so badly. Now only recommend using it in a VM with rollback. #xamarin
@reubenbond @Merrion what he said. Welcome.
Yo @gitlabstatus. Look after YP eh? Send him/her hugs. It's a rough situation; counciling (as in emotional) may be needed. Nightmare stuff.
@reubenbond @kogir ugh. Yeah. There's a void for creators like you and me. Twitter is a partial solution.
@reubenbond @kjacobsen yup. There's someone working on one for dotnet core. I would love to see this concept expand.
@JackUkleja @github send flowers to @_andrewb
@AmpYost welcome to twitter. Are you still doing Xamarin dev? There's now a Perth meetup run by @MZaatar
@blowdart start traveling with burner laptops?
@allanritchie911 yuupp. Are you consuming or producing?
@JackUkleja email ghuntley@ghuntley.com with "yo slack me k thx bi" and I'll send the invite.
@natfriedman @patrickc isn't that a 4 x match because of msft's matching policy?

@paulcbetts @marcgravell after pissing way an entire day on netstandard. I'm starting to agree re: 4.6.x or 4.5.x lyfe
@4dexpert ah; I passed away an entire day getting Xam and netstandard end to end a reality. Glad I'm not the only one.
@nigelsampson @bradygaster yet so incredibly important. Health of the project and Peace of mind of the maintainers. R&R is important.
ITT; uninstalled vs2017 rc because the experience with #xamarin is so poor. I can't be the only one?
@jeremy_h73 @_AndrewB also... This is why this library exists. Bring in conventions over time. There's options to "accept debt"
@RobGibbens @_AndrewB yup exactly. One the things about Sonarqube & stylecop is the feedback isn't immediately useful/high value. This is.
@developerjack rule can be customised to also allow other prefixes. Nice way to prevent commits of commented out dead code. :p
Why doesn't every project start with this? Enforcement of house rules as unit tests. https://t.co/OhC1quE6ZS - Bril… https://t.co/94ktl8IrxR
@developerjack hmm; why roll vs boom? Going to pick one up eventually. Ordered new backpack moments ago https://t.co/pbjUCnKvUC omg omg
@developerjack @ultimateears which one did you get?
Why does this library only have 28 stars? https://t.co/OhC1quE6ZS check out the samples unit tests @ https://t.co/fELzK7lrrf
@JaridKG @PlanetXamarin open a GitHub issue please :)
@devlead @zapier might look into a zap that detects the event.
@devlead ugh. More software dev glue. After much uhm and ahing I forked out for @zapier this year. No regrets.
@devlead ya that was a good read. Section about expectations is spot on. Hard to do; yet important.
@devlead ya confirmed. It's started happening to rxui. Had to write docs/process to cover it https://t.co/ARBUJFbIPx
@MarcBruins nice work. RxUI missing from architecture section though. Would send PR but on phone :)
@alecdtucker @matthewrdev actually four!
@alecdtucker @matthewrdev wait what. Just realised. That's three MVPs at one user group.

@JackUkleja also.... Come join us in Slack.
@JackUkleja they are getting better; fast. I'm planning on taking leave from work soon to make samples. Need UX designer. Know any?
@JackUkleja RxUI is old enough for gradeschool. So yes there has been API changes. Mainly on RxCommand but that's now well documented.
@sinclairinator come join us in Slack!
@kzu @onovotny ding me as well please Oren. RxUI samples are vs2017.
@citizenmatt nice knowing you. :)
@adpead no evolve this year? Fine. As long as it happens 2018.

@PlanetXamarin @JamesMontemagno I'm so glad we brought this back!
@jchannon @citizenmatt love your work
@citizenmatt interesting. Thanks for sharing. Have been thinking about this. Yeoman to generate dotnet feels wierd.
